tweets.hook: ðŸš¨ Dilution pattern on $AMZE. Ran +91%, still up +47%, but a fresh 424B5 ATM hit on 2025-11-13. $2.8M micro-cap, almost no cash, heavy burn, sub-1 month runway. Company needs to sell shares into strength. Full breakdown below â†“
breakdown: 1/ What's an ATM? Company files to sell new shares at market through a broker. They usually hit the bid during spikes because higher prices = more cash per share. More shares sold â†’ more supply â†’ pressure on the stock.

2/ The setup on $AMZE:
â€¢ Mkt cap: ~$2.8M
â€¢ ATM filed: 2025-11-13
â€¢ Move: +91% peak, now +47%
â€¢ Cash: $300K
â€¢ Burn: ~$2.0M/month
â€¢ Runway: < 1 month
â€¢ Already raised $4.6M last quarter via stock
High price + urgent cash need = prime dilution setup.

3/ Confirming signals to watch on $AMZE:
â€¢ Heavy red candle with big volume
â€¢ Selling pressure building each day
â€¢ Key support breaks and does not bounce
â€¢ Already ~45% off highs
Company is in critical distress. Motive to use the ATM is obvious.

4/ Scenarios:
Bear case builds if:
â€¢ Large red candle + volume spike
â€¢ Price cannot reclaim recent highs
â€¢ ATM usage starts showing in filings/volume

Bull invalidation: strong breakout on real volume that holds.
Traders get trapped when dilution hits during pullbacks, not the initial run.

5/ Takeaway on $AMZE:
Micro-cap, tiny float, ATM loaded, and less than a month of cash with $8.1M debt and an accelerating burn. Management has every reason to sell shares into strength.

Not advice â€” pattern recognition only. ðŸ¦…
